intro: Paratropia oxyphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved paratropia, is a small shrub native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Paratropia oxyphylla is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests.
